reviewText: Being a huge fan of the series, this is an absolute gem.  I had some VHS tapes of the original series I've held onto throughout the years, but the picture and audio quality became degraded with age.  Having this collection is just wonderful.  The picture and audio are great, and being able to refresh on some of the original characters that I've forgotten about has been fantastic.  If you are into the new movies, this is a wonderful companion to get some back stories which will enable you to catch the throw-backs or the unnamed Transformers they've placed into the movies.

Title: N/A

reviewText: Sure this collection doesn't include the original movie, but I think that is ok for getting 2220 minutes plus bonus features of one of the most amazing animated series of all time, all for under $55 (15 dvds, that means each one is only $3.33, its GREAT). I may of been born after the 80s, but it doesn't stop me from enjoying it in every way possible. The box is superb, and the cover art for each DVD is amazing. The quality of the DVDs is amazing as well, that is what really stood out to me. Color looked fresh and the sound was amazing. Sure this is only DVD, and someone is going to complain about not having a blue ray of it yet, but DVD is just fine. Heck I still watch VHS videos from time to time, so I can live without blue ray for a while. Main point is this, if you have any love for the Transformers, and you want to have something to keep you entertained when you're pushing 70 or 80 and don't want to watch soap operas or cop dramas, then get this amazing DVD collection and enjoy it to the fullest. There is more than meets the eye in this box set!

reviewText: I can't say enough about this cartoon!  If you remember the original Transformers : Generation One cartoon from the 1980s, This is must have animated DVD set!  The Transformers The complete series  dvd set (1984-1987) is the original version. This is not the Michael Bay/Steven Spielberg live-action movies.  Peter Cullen is the voice of Optimus Prime and Ironhide. Frank Welker is the original voice of Megatron and many other Decepticons. This set includes all 98 episodes of the original Transformers series.  Bonus features include:Rare Public Service AnnouncementsArchival Toy CommercialsArt GalleriesRetrospective FeaturesFrom the Secret Files of Teletran 2PSAsToy CommericalsArt Galleries and many more featuresA++++++Buy the Transformers the complete series DVD set Today!
summary: The Original Transformers Generation One Series!

reviewText: Transformers: The Complete Series is a new 15-DVD collection featuring all 98 remastered original Transformers episodes (and respective special features) from the following:Transformers: The Complete First Season (25th Anniversary Edition)Transformers: Season Two, Volume One (25th Anniversary Edition)Transformers: Season Two, Volume Two (25th Anniversary Edition)Transformers: Seasons Three & Four (25th Anniversary Edition)Touted as an "unlimited" general retail release to replace the limitedTransformers: The Complete Series (25th Anniversary Matrix of Leadership Edition), this 15-disc Collector's Set (housed in a new shiny outer case) is recommended to fans who don't own any of the previous season set releases and don't care about the exclusive bonus material from the Matrix of Leadership Edition as this set no more, no less contains only the disc content from the separate season releases. None of the exclusive extras from the Matrix of Leadership set (nor The Movie or Japanese series) are included. To fans that already own the separate season sets, just know that aside from the new shiny outer case (which you can purchase by itself online at Shout! Factory Store, transforming your sets into one identical to this box set, according to the studio) all of the disc content are the same as the previous releases before you decide.Special Features include:Episodes restored to the original broadcast versions with a new stereo soundtrack created from the original audio.Featurettes: "Triplechanger: From Toy to Comic to Screen - The Origin of the Transformers", "The Combiner: Forming the Animated Series", "The Autobots, The Decepticons & The Fans".From The Files Of Teletraan-2Rare PSAsArchival Hasbro Toy CommmercialsArt Galleries featuring Concept ArtPrintable "Transport to Oblivion" Script
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: What a premise! Advanced alien robots crash-land on earth, are reactivated and repaired to look like earth vehicles, and now duke it out here on earth! And they transform! The bad guys turn into jets, the good guys turn into cars! Cool!Season 2 was terrible and Season 3 was even worse than that.It was a terrible thing to see all my favorite Transformers mysteriously disappear, for no reason. Bluestreak, Hound, Jazz, Mirage, Prowl, Trailbreaker, Wheekjack, Brawn, Cliffjumper. Most of the original Autobots vanished without explanation, while new Transformers kept appearing, also without explanation (BUY MORE TOYS!).Then the Autobots and Decepticons both get a new leader. But Rodimus was too insecure to make decisions, and Galvatron was insane. Seriously, the new leaders were a bigger threat to the Transformers than the Quintessons!They couldn't decide to keep Optimus or not, so they keep killing him and bringing him back. Three times! By the end, he couldn't lead his way out of Autobot headquarters, so he needed a giant glowing ball to tell him what to do. I guess getting killed over and over is enough to make anyone run crying to his daddy.But they had to make the show even worse. By the end, the surviving Transformers had people crawling around in their head. Their head flew off, their gun flew off, and they were left as a super-intelligent transport vehicle (BUY MORE TOYS!). But it creeped me out, made no sense to me, and just left Optimus and Galvatron baffled (remember when they used to LEAD their respective teams?).Season 1 was great fun to watch the first time around and more fun to watch again. But the only thing Season 2 and Season 3 did was make me realize just how amazing Season 1 was.
Title: N/A
